head.title: A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. - Page #16

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #16 of 50 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Wentzel, Willard Ferdinand. A Continuation of the Journal of the Forks Mackenzie's River for Summer 1807-1808. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0022

div.p: Besides these I also Traded 5 Dressed Moose deer Skins[.] As the Grand Chefre Still expects to meet with the Aahotinnais & demands a Frenchman I arranged Jollibois & Sent him off with them, with orders to come as soon as possible with what Provns he could possibly make the Indians bring to the Fort as they may perhaps otherwise eat the whole themselves without remembering that we are usually in want of them[.] Gave him 6 Plat Cotes of Fat Carribou & moose deer – & 6 meass Am. 1 Awl & 2 Flints[.] Took 5 Hares in the Collets[.] N.B. I Kept two young men to Hunt Hares[.]

Monday 10th[.] Gave my Hunters 150 Snares & Sent them to Set these Collets behind the Fort at a very little distance[.] Martin made a Pair of Snow Shoes[.] Snowed pretty hard to day[.] Grand River completely full of Ice[.]
Tuesy 11th[.] Martin folded another pair of Snow Shoes[.] Got the little House finished[.] Fine weather tho' Cold[.]

Wednesy 12th[.] Arrived 5 Indians – Part of that band who I had sent off with Capot Rouge to Hunt the Beaver[.] [T]he cause of their being yet near the Fort – they say was occasioned an by accident having a few Beaver Traps on this side of the Forks[.] [T]hey left their Families on the opposite side, while in their absence the Forks had begun to drive Ice, which obliged them to remain on this side untill the Ice had taken entirely[.] [T]hey brought 24 Skins Beaver & 170 Hares[.] As I am Scarce of Snares I gave 8 Sinews to these Indians to be made into Collets[.] Traded 60 Hares & 7 Skins furrs – and Sent them off[.] [T]hey must now remain to wait untill a young man comes from Capot Rouge, as none of these Knows the road to where the Beaver Lives[.]

Thursy 13th[.] Three young men came again to day who brought 16 Skins furrs & 2 Cascameats[.] Sent them off again[.] [T]his is the 5th time these young men have come with Skins to the Fort[.] My Hunters brought 20 Hares to day[.] Since the day before yesterday Beaulieu & James Sutherland Killed 6 Hares[.] Snowed to day[.] [G]ave 6 Sinews to get Collets made[.] Martin made another Pair of Snow Shoes[.]
Friday 14th[.] The men piercing & putting barrs to their Snow Shoes[.] Fine weather[.]
Satury 15th[.] Croup de Chien brought us 5 Skins furrs & 2 Cascameats[.] [T]his makes him 15 Skins in advance upon a Gun[.] Engaged

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
